message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Flutamide is an androgen receptor antagonist, and leuprolide is a gonadotropin-releasing hormone agonist that decreases testosterone levels. Therefore, the addition of leuprolide would be the most beneficial in treating metastatic prostate cancer. Anastrozole is used in the treatment of breast cancer, and cyproterone is used in the treatment of androgen-dependent conditions such as acne and hirsutism. Clomiphene is used in the treatment of infertility.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Flutamide is an androgen receptor antagonist used to treat prostate cancer. Leuprolide is a gonadotropin-releasing hormone agonist used for androgen deprivation therapy in prostate cancer. Therefore, addition of leuprolide to the patient’s medication regimen would benefit in the treatment of the patient’s condition. Anastrozole, Clomiphene, and Cyproterone are not typically used to treat advanced prostate cancer.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Leuprolide is a hormone therapy used to treat advanced prostate cancer by reducing the level of testosterone in the body. Flutamide is also a hormone therapy that works by blocking the action of testosterone, but combining it with leuprolide has been shown to be more effective in treating metastatic prostate cancer than flutamide alone. Anastrozole, clomiphene, and cyproterone are not commonly used in the treatment of metastatic prostate cancer.

Leuprolide is a type of hormone therapy that reduces the production of testosterone, which can help slow the growth of prostate cancer cells. Anastrozole is used to treat breast cancer and is unlikely to benefit a patient with prostate cancer. Clomiphene is used to treat infertility in women, and cyproterone is used to treat conditions such as hirsutism and acne.

Leuprolide is a luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone (LHRH) agonist that suppresses the production of testosterone, which can help in the treatment of advanced prostate cancer. Anastrozole is not used to treat prostate cancer and is instead used in the treatment of breast cancer. Clomiphene is used to induce ovulation in women and has no role in the treatment of prostate cancer. Cyproterone is an antiandrogen medication, but it is not commonly used in the treatment of prostate cancer.

Leuprolide is a gonadotropin-releasing hormone agonist and works by decreasing testosterone levels, which is beneficial in the treatment of prostate cancer. Anastrozole is an aromatase inhibitor and is used to treat breast cancer. Clomiphene is a fertility medication and is not relevant to the treatment of prostate cancer. Therefore, the correct answer is (A) Leuprolide.
